scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, there is lumber all over the apartment]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey-hey-hey. So what happened? A forest tick you off?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No. Y'know how we’re always saying we need a place for the mail.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I started building one. But then I decided to take it to the next step.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You’re building a post office?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, an entertainment unit, with a mail cubby built right in. It’s a one day job, max.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay. (notices that Joey is wearing some really tight jeans) My word! Those are snug.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah. These are my old work pants, Sergio Valente’s.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Power saw kinda got away from me there.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, there is lumber all over the apartment]

events.event_description: Chandler enters the apartment and greets Joey.
Joey responds to Chandler's greeting.
Chandler asks Joey about what happened, implying Joey's activity involving lumber.
Joey explains he started building a mail storage area and decided to upgrade it.
Chandler questions Joey about building a post office.
Joey clarifies he is building an entertainment unit with a mail cubby, not a post office.
Joey states that the project is a one-day job at most.
Chandler notices Joey wearing tight jeans and comments on them.
Joey responds to Chandler's comment about his jeans.
Joey mentions that the power saw got away from him during the project.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is pacing back and forth waiting for someone.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (joining Phoebe outside) Hey Pheebs.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Any sign of your brother?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, but he’s always late.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I thought you only met him once?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I did. I think it sounds y'know big sistery, y'know, ‘Frank’s always late.’

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well relax, he’ll be here.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I know, I’m just nervous. Y'know it’s just y'know Mom’s dead, don’t talk to my sister, Grandma’s been sleeping a lot lately. It’s like the last desperate chance to have a family, y'know, kinda thing. You’re so sweet to wait with me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, actually Gunther sent me. You’re not allowed to have cups out here, it’s a thing. (takes her cup and goes back inside)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Outside Central Perk, Phoebe is pacing back and forth waiting for someone.]

events.event_description: Phoebe paces back and forth outside Central Perk while waiting for someone.
Rachel joins Phoebe outside and greets her.
Rachel asks Phoebe if there is any sign of her brother.
Phoebe responds that her brother is always late.
Rachel questions Phoebe about how many times she has met her brother.
Phoebe explains that she has only met her brother once and comments on her family dynamics.
Rachel advises Phoebe to relax about her brother's lateness.
Phoebe expresses her nervousness and mentions her family members' recent issues.
Rachel comments on Phoebe's situation and thanks her for waiting with her.
Rachel informs Phoebe that Gunther sent her and takes her cup back inside, reminding Phoebe of the rule about cups outside.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Does anyone else think David Copperfield is cute?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, but he told me, he thinks your a fox.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, Janice, likes him. In fact she likes him so much she put him on her freebie list.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Her what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, we have a deal, where we each get to pick five celebrities that we can sleep with, and the other one can’t get mad.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ah, the heart of every healthy relationship. Honesty, respect, and sex with celebrities.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, Chandler, who’s on your list?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ah, Kim Basinger, Cindy Crawford, Halle Berry, Yasmine Bleeth, and ah, Jessica Rabbit.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Now, you do realize that she’s a cartoon, and way out of your league?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know, I know, I just always wondered if I could get her eyes to pop out of her head.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, Monica, who would yours be?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: First, I need a boyfriend, then I can have a list.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It’s just a game Mon. (makes a ‘Can-you-believe-her’ face to the rest of the gang.) Rach, how about you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I don’t know, I guess, Chris O’Donnel, John F. Kennedy, Jr., Daniel Day Lewis, Sting, and Parker Stevenson.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Spiderman?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hardy Boy.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Peter Parker.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What about you honey, who would be on your list?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well I-I-I, that kind of thing requires some serious thought. First, I’ll divide my perspective canidates into catergories....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (coughing) What a geek!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Everbody this is Frank! This is my half-brother Frank.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is everybody. This is Ross.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: How are you?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey-hey!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: This is Monica.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Whoa!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: And this is Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Whoa!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I’m gonna get coffee.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hey, how do you guys get anything done?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We don’t, really.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, so, now, do you guys have a lot of big plans?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh yeah! Yeah, no, we’re gonna connect, y'know bond, and everything.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah, I was thinking that maybe we could go down to Time Square and pick up some ninja stars. And, oh, um, my friend Larry, he wants me to take a picture of a hooker.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, we don’t really take advantage of living in the city.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I know.

events.event_description: Chandler asks if anyone else finds David Copperfield cute.
Monica tells Chandler that David Copperfield thinks she is attractive.
Chandler explains Janice's interest in David Copperfield and their celebrity deal.
Joey asks Monica about her celebrity list.
Chandler lists his five celebrity crushes for his 'freebie list'.
Rachel lists her celebrity crushes, including Chris O’Donnell and Parker Stevenson.
Ross humorously categorizes his celebrity choices and comments on Spider-Man and Hardy Boy.
Phoebe introduces Frank as her half-brother to the group.
Frank greets the group and mentions wanting to go to Times Square to pick up ninja stars and take a picture of a hooker.
Chandler comments that they don't take advantage of city life, implying a lack of city activities.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is drilling a hole in the wall and the drill
comes out the other side really close to Chandler’s head. Chandler then rushes out to
talk to Joey.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Did I get ‘ya?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, you didn’t get me!! It’s an electric drill, you get me, you kill me!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Calm down, do you want this unit or not?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I do NOT want this unit!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, you should’ve told me that before, I’m not a mind reader. Hey, we’re out of beer. I’m going to Monica’s.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Fine! (goes into his room and slams the door, then he slams the bottom half of the door.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is drilling a hole in the wall and the drill
comes out the other side really close to Chandler’s head. Chandler then rushes out to
talk to Joey.]

events.event_description: Joey drills a hole in the wall, causing the drill to come out near Chandler's head.
Chandler rushes out of the room to confront Joey after the drill incident.
Joey apologizes to Chandler, asking if he got him with the drill.
Chandler responds angrily, warning Joey that the drill could have killed him.
Joey asks Chandler if he wants the unit he is drilling for, implying a repair or installation task.
Chandler refuses to take the unit, expressing his displeasure.
Joey comments that Chandler should have told him he didn't want the unit, indicating a miscommunication.
Joey announces he is going to Monica's because they are out of beer.
Chandler reacts by going into his room, slamming the door, and then slamming the bottom half of the door.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey! Where ‘ya headin’ in those pants? 1982?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh Monica, listen, I ah, I saw down at the hardware store, they got those designer tiles on sale. If you ever want to redo the bathroom floor.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why, what’s wrong with my bathroom floor?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nothing. It’s just old and dingy, that’s all.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I highly doubt that. (they both go to the bathroom)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh yeah. If you ah, move your hamper, you see what color the tile used to be. (Monica gasps) Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can’t live like this! What are we gonna do? What are we gonna do?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Relax. Here hold this (hands her his beer). This old stuff just comes right off. (he bends down to try and lift some tile right in the middle of the floor, in his tight pants.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s a little more than I wanted to see.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (manages to pry off only a small piece) Aw! Look at that, every inch of this stuff is glued down. It’d take forever to pry this up. You should ah, you should just leave it. (starts to walk away, but Monica grabs him)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I can’t leave it! You gouged a hole in my dingy floor.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Eh! There you go.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You know that’s nice, y'know we could put it back there after the surgeons remove it from your colon!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey is entering]

events.event_description: Joey enters Monica and Rachel's apartment.
Monica greets Joey and questions his destination.
Joey explains he saw designer tiles on sale at the hardware store and suggests redoing the bathroom floor.
Monica questions why her bathroom floor would need redoing.
Joey attempts to pry up a tile from the bathroom floor to show its color.
Monica reacts with surprise and concern as Joey tries to lift the tile.
Joey manages to pry off a small piece of tile, indicating it is glued down.
Joey suggests leaving the tile as it is because removing it would take a long time.
Monica protests about Joey gouging a hole in her floor and expresses frustration.
Monica sarcastically comments about putting the tile back after surgeons remove it from Joey's colon.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank and her, are sitting on the counh, watching TV]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (sits up) Oh, ew!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah I know what I wanted to ask you. Um, can you roll your tongue? Because I can, and my Mom couldn’t, and I thought y'know, I figured that was something I got from our Dad.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: What, wait, you mean like this? (does it)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah. You can do it to. (tries to do it, but can’t)

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Your not doing it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh right, yeah okay, my Mom could, and I can’t. We don’t have that....

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: When’s your birthday?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Feburary 16th.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: I know a guy who’s the 18th.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, that’s close. When’s yours?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: October 25th.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s the same month as Halloween. So, um, what kinda things do you like to do at home?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Melt stuff.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank and her, are sitting on the counh, watching TV]

events.event_description: Phoebe exclaims 'Oh, ew!' upon sitting up during the scene.
Phoebe asks Frank if he can roll his tongue, suggesting she can do it and her mother couldn't.
Frank demonstrates how to roll his tongue.
Phoebe attempts to roll her tongue but fails.
Phoebe clarifies that her mother could roll her tongue but she cannot.
Phoebe shares her birthday as February 16th.
Frank mentions knowing someone born on February 18th.
Phoebe asks Frank when his birthday is.
Frank states his birthday as October 25th.
Phoebe comments that October 25th is close to Halloween.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is working on his list]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I’ve got three of my five.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Three of your five, what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Celebrities I’m allowed to sleep with.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God! You are giving this a lot of thought.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, it’s hard okay, I only have two spots left.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: All right, so who do you got it narrowed down to?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, Elizabeth Hurely....

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oooh-hoo, very attractive, forgiving.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Susan Sarandon.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Eh, y'know what, she’s to political, she probably wouldn’t let you do it, unless you donated four cans of food first.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And!! Isabella Rosselini.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ooh-hoo. Very hot, very sexy. But ah, y'know she’s too international, y'know she’s never gonna be around.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: So?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So, you gotta play the odds, pick somebody who’s gonna be in the country like all the time.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, ‘cause that’s why you won’t get Isabella Rosselini, geography.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Ross is working on his list]

events.event_description: Ross states he has three celebrities out of five on his list.
Rachel asks Ross what he means by 'three of your five'.
Ross explains he is listing celebrities he is allowed to sleep with.
Chandler inquires about Ross's narrowed-down list of celebrities.
Ross mentions Elizabeth Hurely as a celebrity on his list.
Chandler comments that Elizabeth Hurely is very attractive and forgiving.
Ross lists Susan Sarandon as a celebrity on his list.
Chandler comments that Susan Sarandon is too political and might not agree unless Ross donates food.
Ross mentions Isabella Rosselini as a celebrity on his list.
Chandler comments that Isabella Rosselini is very hot but too international to be around often.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank is melting a plastic spoon.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay so, by melting, you meant melting.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So is it like art?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah, you can melt art. Hey, can I use your phone?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, yeah sure. Why you wanna call your Mom?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: No, I wanna melt it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, well um, not right now. Y'know I’m just gonna go to bed, I think the fumes are giving me a headache.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: (starts laughing) Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: G’night, bro.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: G’night.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Here. (gives him a fire extinguisher) Y'know, just in case.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, excellent. (starts to melt the fire extinguisher’s hose.)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank is melting a plastic spoon.]

events.event_description: Frank melts a plastic spoon over a heat source.
Phoebe questions whether Frank's melting activity is considered art.
Frank confirms that melting can be considered art.
Phoebe asks Frank if he wants to call his mom.
Frank states he wants to melt Phoebe's phone instead of calling his mom.
Phoebe declines Frank's request to melt her phone, citing fumes causing a headache.
Frank laughs in response to Phoebe's explanation.
Phoebe says goodnight and prepares to leave, indicating she is going to bed.
Phoebe gives Frank a fire extinguisher for safety.
Frank starts melting the hose of the fire extinguisher.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is
playing with num-chucks on the balcony]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What kind of karate is that?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No kind. He just makes it up.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So how’s it going with you guys?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: So far, it kinda blows. I don’t know, I just thought y'know that he’d feel more like a brother y'know, like you and Ross, just like close and connected and....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh honey, we’re close now but you-you wouldn’t believe the years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and....(Phoebe shakes her head like she doesn’t understand) That’s where the waistband actually goes over your head.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ah!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, we used to drive each other crazy playing the shadow game.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I just asked you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I just asked you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t have time for this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: No, that is what the game is.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Which you just gave up really quickly.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering) Have you seen Joey?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What’s the matter?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, just this! (turns around and has a paint lid stuck to the back of his pants.) Y’know what it’s my fault really, because the couch is usually where we keep the varnish.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (yelling from bathroom) Hey, does somebody wanna hand me one of those tiles.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He’s retiling my floor. (they both run to the bathroom)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yo!! Spackel boy! Get up!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ah-ah-ah, now you started this, you will finish it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: He started mine first!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Build the unit Cinderelly, lay the tile Cinderelly.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is
playing with num-chucks on the balcony]

events.event_description: Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica at the scene.
Frank is playing with num-chucks on the balcony outside.
Monica asks Phoebe about the type of karate Frank is practicing.
Phoebe responds that Frank makes up his karate moves.
Monica inquires about Phoebe's relationship with her brother.
Phoebe expresses disappointment about her relationship with her brother.
Monica describes the history of sibling pranks like nugies and wedgies.
Chandler enters and asks if Phoebe has seen Joey.
Chandler shows that he has a paint lid stuck to the back of his pants.
Monica and Chandler run to the bathroom after Joey calls for help with tiling.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.]

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Whoa! Big octopus.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. (phone rings and Phoebe answers it) ‘Hello. (listens) Oh my God, I totally forgot! (listens) Well can’t someone else do it. (listens) But, I have company. (listens) Yeah, no look, that’s all right I’ll come in.’ (hangs up phone) Um, Frank, I’m really sorry but I have to go to work. It’s-it’s one of my regulars and he’s insisting that I do ‘um.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hey, what kind of work do you do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh! I’m a masseuse. I give people massages and stuff.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: You-you work at one of those massage parlors?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, y'know we don’t call it that, but yeah!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: (starts laughing) Wow! That’s wild! No, I had no idea.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All righty. I’ll be back in-in a little bit. Unless you wanna come with me?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: You mean like watch?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, you can get one yourself. It’ll be on the house! Y'know what are big sisters for?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well, I don’t think this, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, no, I wouldn’t do you myself, I mean that would be weird. Yeah, no, I’ll get one of the other girls to do it. Oh, this will be so much fun! Hey! Are you excited?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah! Hey, do Monica and Rachel work there?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.]

events.event_description: Phoebe and Frank watch TV together at Phoebe's apartment.
Frank exclaims, 'Whoa! Big octopus,' while watching TV.
Phoebe answers her phone and listens to the caller, reacting with surprise.
Phoebe informs Frank that she has to go to work for a regular customer.
Frank asks Phoebe about her occupation.
Phoebe reveals she is a masseuse and gives a brief description of her job.
Frank questions if she works at a massage parlor.
Phoebe clarifies that they don't call it a massage parlor but confirms her occupation.
Phoebe invites Frank to come with her to work, offering him a free massage.
Frank expresses curiosity about whether Monica and Rachel work at the same place.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It’s beautiful! It’s like the first bathroom floor there ever was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What, like a number?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little card)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, it’s about time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Ooh, very official.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, well y'know Chandler printed it up on his computer.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And who laminated it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That would be me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, it’s my list.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.]

events.event_description: Monica admires the new bathroom floor and comments on its beauty.
Chandler attempts to go to the bathroom and asks if he is going for a 'number'.
Ross enters the scene and greets everyone.
Chandler quickly leaves the bathroom after Ross enters.
Ross shows a laminated card with his final choices.
Rachel comments on Ross's list of names.
Ross defends his list, explaining Chandler printed it on his computer.
Rachel questions the names on Ross's list, noting that she only spins like that on ice.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebe’s work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm,
to the room Phoebe is in by another girl.]

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Ow!-Ow!-Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Y'know, ow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey!-Hey! What’s going on?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: She broke my arm.

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: He touched my fanny.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: No, she touched mine first!

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: That’s my job!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: So wait, what’s the deal here, I can have sex with you, but I can’t touch you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE AND GIRL
dialogue.text: Ewww!!!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You can’t have sex with her!

dialogue.speaker: GIRL
dialogue.text: What’d you think I was, a hooker?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: No, your a masseuse, it’s cool, I’m not a cop.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, Jasmine, can you, can you ask Mr. Whiffler if he can wait for like five minutes.

dialogue.speaker: JASMINE
dialogue.text: Fine. (starts to leave, and points at Frank) I don’t like you!! (leaves)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (turns around and hits Frank) So that’s what you thought I did!! God! That’s not what I do!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Wait that’s-that’s, what that’s not what you do?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Nooo! Why would you think that?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: I don’t know, I mean, y'know, this is the city y'know, I just, I mean, I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whatever, it’s the perfect end to the perfect weekend anyways.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, no your right, no it was perfect and I can’t believe that I screwed it up so bad.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: You really thought it was perfect?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well, no, maybe-maybe it wasn’t perfect, but y'know it was pretty cool, y'know, ‘cause we had all those great talks y'know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, um, which ones in particular were great for you?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well y'know about the tongue thing, y'know, and how I told you about my likes and my dislikes...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don’t....

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: How-how I like to melt stuff, and how I dislike stuff that doesn’t melt.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Right, okay, um-mm.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know I feel like I can really talk to you ‘cause y'know you’re my sister, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I guess I do, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Then I go feel your friend up and make you mad at me.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I-I wasn’t hopping mad, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: You hopped a little bit. Yeah, I really sorry.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. All right, this is my favourite part of the weekend, right now, this.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: This?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh come on we went, we went to Time Square, we found ninja stars, I almost got arm broken by a hooker...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: She wasn’t a hooker.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well, when I tell my friends about her she will be.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebe’s work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm,
to the room Phoebe is in by another girl.]

events.event_description: Frank is being led into the room by another girl, with Phoebe present, by the arm.
Frank exclaims in pain, repeatedly saying 'Ow!', indicating he has been injured.
Phoebe questions Frank about his pain, asking 'What’s going on?'
Frank claims that a girl broke his arm.
Girl states that Frank touched her fanny.
Frank denies touching Girl first, claiming she touched his arm first.
Girl asserts that touching her fanny is her job, implying a sexual context.
Frank questions whether he can have sex with Girl but not touch her, indicating confusion or misunderstanding.
Jasmine is asked to ask Mr. Whiffler to wait for five minutes and then leaves the scene, expressing dislike for Frank.
Phoebe hits Frank, expressing anger and defending her reputation.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, everyone is there, helping to lift the entertainment
center into place]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, on three. One....Two....

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Why don’t we just go on two.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Why two?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Because it’s faster.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, I coulda counted to three like four times without all this ‘two’ talk.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, but in the future...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay!! Okay!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Heavy thing, not getting lighter!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, one...two...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So we are going on two?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: All right!! (they lift it into place, however there is one small problem, the unit is so long that it blocks some of both of their bedroom doors.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, good job Joe.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Wow, it’s big!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah-yeah, so big that it actually makes our doors look smaller!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe, my ruler’s wrong.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Maybe all the rulers are wrong.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look it’s not that bad. So what, it blocks a little of your door, a little of my door.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, y'know what I got a better idea. How-how ‘bout it blocks none of mine door and a lot of yours? (throws his shoulder into the center to try and move it, but it doesn’t move.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, listen, before I forget that side is still wet.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, everyone is there, helping to lift the entertainment
center into place]

events.event_description: Chandler initiates lifting the entertainment center by counting down 'One... Two...'
Joey suggests going on two instead of three to lift the entertainment center, claiming it is faster
Chandler questions Joey about why they are going on two, expressing confusion about the counting method
All characters agree to lift the entertainment center together and successfully lift it into place
The entertainment center blocks some of the bedroom doors due to its size
Chandler comments that the entertainment center makes their doors look smaller
Joey remarks that his ruler might be wrong about the size of the entertainment center
Phoebe suggests that all rulers might be wrong regarding the size of the entertainment center
Chandler proposes a plan to prevent the entertainment center from blocking his door, suggesting it should block none of his door and more of Joey's
Chandler attempts to move the entertainment center by shoulder-ramming it, but it does not move

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving some guy coffee.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay sir, um-mm, let see if I got this right. Ah, so this is a half-caf, double tall, easy hazel nut, non-fat, no foam, with whip, extra hot latte, right? (the guy nods) Okay, great. (she starts to walk away and under her breath) You freak.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Gunther) Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: (to Gunther) Um, coffee to go, please.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Isabella Rosselini. (points to her)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Are you serious? (they all look) Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Damn! I can’t believe I took her off my list.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? ‘Cause otherwise you’d go for it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, maybe.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh-oh, you lie.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What you don’t think I’d go up to her?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, it took you ten years to finally admit you liked me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, well missy, you better be glad that list is laminated.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You know what honey, you go ahead, we’ll call her an alternate.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, hold my crawler.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Rach, are you really gonna let him do this?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, he’s about to go hit on Isabella Rosselini. I’m just sorry we don’t got popcorn.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to Isabella) Hi! Hi, I’m Ross, you don’t know me, but I’m a big, big fan of yours. I mean, Blue Velvet , woo-oo hoo! Um, I was wondering if I could um, maybe buy you a cup of coffee? (Gunther hands her change) Or maybe reimburse you for that one?

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: Aren’t you with that girl over there? (points at Rachel, who waves back)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, yeah, kinda. Um, but that’s okay, see we have an understanding, um, see we each have this list of five famous people, (gets his out) so I’m allowed to sleep with you. No, no, no, it’s flattery.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: I’m sorry. (starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh no, no, no, wait, wait, Isabella. Don’t, don’t just dismiss this so fast. I mean this is a once in a lifetime opportunity...

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: Yeah, for you. Is that the list?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: May I see it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um, no.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: Come on! (grabs the list)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: But, okay.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: (reading it) I’m not on the list!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Um, see, but that’s not the final draft.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: It’s laminated!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, um, okay see, you were, you were on the list but my friend, Chandler (Chandler waves) brought up the very good point that you are international, so I bumped you for Wynona Rider, local.

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: Y'know it’s ironic...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ISABELLA
dialogue.text: ...because I have a list of five goofy coffee house guys and yesterday I bumped you for that guy over there. (points at a guy and leaves)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (to the rest of the gang) We’re just gonna be friends.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Rachel is serving some guy coffee.]

events.event_description: Rachel serves a coffee to a customer, describing the order in detail.
Rachel mutters 'You freak' under her breath after starting to walk away from the customer.
Ross thanks Gunther for something.
Isabella orders coffee to go from Gunther.
Ross introduces himself to Isabella Rosselini and expresses admiration for her work.
Ross explains his 'list of five famous people' to Isabella.
Isabella questions Ross about his relationship status and the list.
Isabella takes the list from Ross and reads it, discovering her name is not on it.
Isabella comments on her own list of coffee house guys and leaves after mentioning she bumped Ross off her list.
Ross states to the group that they will just be friends after Isabella leaves.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, they are admiring the entertainment center]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'know what?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Umm?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I bet ‘ya ya I could fit in there. (points to a hole in the center)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I’ve got five bucks says you can’t.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Get out your checkbook, mister.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I think I have the cash.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You are dogged man! I totally fit!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, you got me. (picks up a 2x4 and puts it through the handles so that the doors won’t open) I’m out five big ones! (puts the money in the crack between the door and frame) Here you go.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you. Cha-ching! (Chandler starts to leave) Oh, well hello Mr. Lincoln. Better luck next time buddy. (Chandler leaves and closes the door) And the drinks are on me!

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey’s, they are admiring the entertainment center]

events.event_description: Joey points to a hole in the entertainment center and claims he can fit inside it.
Chandler accepts Joey's challenge and bets five dollars that Joey cannot fit in the hole.
Joey confidently asserts he can fit in the hole and challenges Chandler to get out his checkbook.
Chandler retrieves five dollars and agrees to the bet, placing the money in the crack between the door and frame after Joey claims he fits.
Chandler places the five-dollar bill in the crack between the door and frame, indicating he has paid Joey.
Joey celebrates his confidence with a 'Cha-ching' and comments on Chandler's departure.
Chandler places a 2x4 through the handles of the entertainment center to prevent the doors from opening and leaves the scene.
Joey comments on Chandler's departure by saying 'And the drinks are on me!', implying he is still confident about fitting in the hole.
